clinical_study.official_title: Virologic and Immunologic Evaluation of the Deep Viral Reservoirs in HIV-1 Infected Patients With Long Term Viral Suppression

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective study in HIV-1 infected patients with a plasma viral load below the limit of detection and stable for at least 5 years.

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the mucosal HIV reservoirs (HIV-DNA quantification and distribution of the infected T lymphocytes in the gut mucosa associated lymphoid tissue compared to the blood in HIV-1 infected patients under antiretroviral treatment with an undetectable plasma viral load below the 50 copies/ml limit of detection for at least 5 years).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantification of the HIV-RNA plasma viral load using ultrasensible assay (limit of detection: 1 copy/ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of the HIV proviral DNA in the rectal mucosa biopsies and in the PPBMCs
Quantitative, phenotypic and functional description of the long-term immune reconstitution in the rectal mucosa biopsies
Quantification of HIV proviral DNA in the total CD4 lymphocytes
Pharmacokinetics of the antiretroviral molecules in the rectal mucosa biopsies and in the blood

intervention.description: Collection of a maximum of 15 rectal mucosa samples in the high portion of the rectum near the rectosigmoidal junction

biospec_descr.textblock: Plasma and total blood samples A maximum of 15 rectal mucosa biopsy samples

study_pop.textblock: HIV-1 infected patients followed in specialized infectious disease/HIV hospital department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-1 documented infection
- HIV-1 plasma viral load measurable before antiretroviral treatment initiation
- Patients treated with an antiretroviral combination containing a protease inhibitor and/or a non-nucleosidic reverse transcriptase inhibitor without any interruption since treatment initiation
- Patients with a stable plasma viral load below the limit of detection (HIV-RNA < 50 copies/ml since January 2006 and/or HIV-RNA < 200 copies/ml during the anterior period) under antiretroviral treatment for at least 5 years and for at least 90 % of the measures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to the biopsy
- No ability or willingness to provide informed consent
- Concomitant treatment with antithrombotics or platelets antiaggregatory
- Patients co-infected with HCV and or HBV
- Patients who received an immunosuppressive treatment during 3 months prior enrollment (chemotherapy, radiotherapy, corticotherapy, splenectomy) or an immunotherapy during 5 years prior enrolment (IL-2, anti-HIV vaccine, IFN-alpha)
